transcript.content: Urge to be polite. I can never just go "I don't know who you are.".
I wa- I - I look for clues.
When they say "Are you still, uh, dunno...", I go "Yeah", so I go "Right!" *incoherent noises* "- and what about so-and-so?" I go, "So... those two people - zoom - and it's like a -"
"- zoosh - sort in my brain, going "Oh, they must - I must know them from so-and-so!"

Yeah. Well I we-, I went, I went back to Bristol once and I remember, um, walking to the bus stop and seeing someone I recognised from school and walking all the way to the next bus stop just so I don't have to stand there and make conversation...
Cause, I just thought I've got nothing.
Well, it's the conversation is the worse bit.
What can we talk about? We've got nothing in common except the fact that we went to the same school.

I was on the train station platform fairly recently and a guy comes over, he goes "Ooh, Steve! How's it going, mate?" and I looked at him stone-faced - I had no idea who it was. But of course, I had to go "Good mate, good. How are you?". And you, and I, kind of, I had a newspaper and I kept looking at the newspaper thinking "Every time I look at this newspaper it's a clue for you to just walk away."
But he never took the clue. He never took it. So, I'd just - I'd say "Oh yeah, not bad, not bad."
And read the paper and he'd go...
"*Sigh*... where you livin' at the moment?" so I'd tell him and he'd say...
And I'd look at the paper again... "Ooh, do you still know, um..."

B-but that's - when - when you know who they are it's just as bad cause they go "Oh, we should have a drink some time!" and you want to go "Uh, I - I'll be honest, look. If I wanted to get in touch with you I had loads of opportunities. I've had every day from now right back to the last 15 years I could of made contact. I didn't."
If you are listening to this and you perhaps know me from school or university...
I do not need your friendship. I've got enough friends.
I have a number of better friends that I prefer. The reason I've not kept in touch is because I don't really like you.
I've moved on. I know people now the likes of which have won major awards.
Ricky Gervais to name but one! He's happy!
Ricky Gervais. As you can see he's sat right here right next to me now.
That's all the friendship a man needs.
If you have - if you have one four BAFTA's?
Then give me a bell. If you have not, kindly stay in your little - in - underneath your particular rock!
Because we're not interested. We have kept you out of our lives for a reason. I did not accidentally lose your number.
When I promised to send you a letter it did not - it did not get lost in the post. Nothing gets lost in the post.
Oh... Yeah, exactly. Karl, what do you think of that?
B-but I'm - I'm honest with them though. When I see them.
Do you know what I mean? I just say "I don't know who you are. Can't remember ya. Not bothered."

Oh, well. I've got to play this. Now. Be. Be warned. This is a rock ballad off of the new Darkness album. I, I love the - love the album. And I know it's a bit "cheek in tongue", it's got shades of Def Leppard, right? But there's lovely balalaika bit in it and it's quite a nice song and it's the Darkness and then they can get away with this sort of thing for at least another four months.
Making plans for Nigel XTC on Xfm 104.9. Well, you seem a little bit happier... No?

Yeah, yeah, it was it was all right. I'm a bit worried, ab- like I said, the last thing, that we just talked about. I don't want people thinking, you know, we're having a go at anyone because that... it does do me head in
Because I'm the one that when I was asked to deal with it as well when people do
You know, we're just talking having a chat about tennis and stuff.
Yeah, the little fellows in the wheelchair as you put it.

Just that they'll think we're having a go on and that because sometimes I do have to take calls and deal with it all this stuff, right? You don't see that you don't see the hassle I have to go through.
No, but I don't often say things where I'm likely to get a complaint from someone...
Yeah but I'm just saying it wasn't meant to be taken... badly - d'you know what I mean?
You're allowed to say you thought that the quality of tennis - because they were confined to a wheelchair - was poorer than say Sampras versus Agassi.
I don't think that's in question. It wasn't as good a game of tennis. That's what all you're saying. You weren't saying. They shouldn't play or...
No no, I'm just saying as well... just...
I can confirm incidentally we've had several emails. I can't confirm that Riverdance opened the Paralympics in Dublin recently. So, I'm sure that was very good.
Yeah. No, I'm sure it was entertaining. They're very good.
Who was it the thought... was is it Jimmy that thought...
It was short for paraplegic Olympics?
Yeah, it's pa... it's parallel Olympics.
Yeah, but as we pointed out that would be pretty much.

There wouldn't be many sports in the paraplegic Olympics. It stands for parallel Olympics. I'M EDUCATING KARL! DON'T LOOK AT ME LIKE THAT, I'M EDUCATING! I'm not saying funny little fellas in wheelchairs playing in the grass!
I'm always educating and I'm always telling you about stuff that I learn about and that.
That you get of ananova and it's about a monkey who became king!
NO?! Have you got monkey news this week?
Got a little bit of monkeynews coming up.
What did he do drive to Spain? Rob a bank or get married?
No, we're done. We've done all them.
It's a good one. It's a good one. And in fact is a bit related to what we've been talking about.
Last week after your nervous breakdown. You went to Hastings. Can I ask why the hell did you go to Hastings? It's so arbitrary.
You lost him on "Arbitrary". Why did you choose that above all other places within...?
It's amazing, isn't it? You look at his face when you say a word, you know, he does understand and it just goes dead.
It's like when a your computer freezes.

Yeah. It is like it is like that, yeah. Is there is there an equivalent to control-alt-delete when karl just doesn't understand something you have to press... like knob, bollock, finger up arse. It takes him out of his sort of stupid doesn't it?
Now that's three things to Press we've only got two hands so

Well. Yeah I know... God what would I do. so I'd have - hold on - the thumb... the thumb of right and pop that up his arse. I'd have my volume index finger of my left hand on his knob. How would I press his testicles, what would I use I have to use some other part.
Yeah, lets go and have him.
(away from microphone) no come on. sit down... sit down.
(away from microphone) I just think it's time we had a little kiss.
I've already had a little... uhh...
(away from microphone) What are you doing?!
I'm just going to give you a little kiss! for the webcam...
Right. Yeah, but the funny thing is on the door it just said "come in and browse"...
But the funny thing is... the funny thing is, right, so you can imagine them sat there going "oh, not doing that well", and it's changed, they've actually changed the name of the shop now.
And now it says "Chess and Bridge".
Right, they've had to expand it.
So they've opened it up a little bit.
What do you buy for bridge? If not a pack of cards.
I don't know, I don't play bridge. But I don't know... I don't think you need a lot of stuff for bridge except a pack of cards.
I remember going, when I was on...
A table. Three friends. Go on.
... on holiday once in Devon, past a shop. I don't know, if you ever need it - if you ever need an antique marionette...
... let me know 'cause I know where there's a shop.
Again, you only need one, unless you're a collector.

But I wanna know who goes into this business. "Well son, what are you doing?" "Going to university to do law, father." "Well, there's a factory there that makes the little plastic bits that goes on the end of chair legs. Do you wanna take it over for me?" ...
... "Well not really, no." "It's all set up!"
"It's all set up!" "Oh... alright Dad, but just for a couple of years."
Someone's gotta make the little plastic bits that go on the end of chairs.
Well if you make them, call us on 1234-9734.
Right listen, Songs of Phrase answers next, we'll get that out of the way?
Well I'll tell you what, play it once more so that people have got a chance to actually enter.
Keep talking, keep talking, keep talking.
It should be ready, Karl. This is terrible.
That is the well-known phrase "Daddy's never gonna stop robbing telephone box".
And we're looking for the songs. I think. I don't care.
The Thrills - Santa Cruz (You're Not That Far)
The Libertines - Don't Look Back Into The Sun
Libertines on XFM 104.9, I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant, over there is Karl K-Man Pilkers!
I'd be great for Heart, wouldn't I?
You really would. You really would.
Virgin I'd be... BBC Radio 2'd be my fir... or 1. Late-night 1...
All good stations. All professional stations.
All have an audience. All have an audience.
... four weeks to go before we may give up, or we may come back. Who knows? ...
... It's all up to Karl K-Man Pilkoids.
Can I just extend an apology? I was a little bit crass earlier and I made some unsavoury remarks about Radio 1 DJ Chris Moyles. I'd like to apologise.
Funny man... funny man, Chris Moyles.
I would like to apologise for that but it gave me an idea - you, the listeners, who do you hate?

Um... email in: ricky.gervais@xfm.co.uk. I just think that we've never really used XFM as a kind of... well, as a research tool really. And it seems to me that we got... we can get a great opportunity here...
And it's this... we don't sort of do this thing... we don't go on air and sort of like slag off other people and people in the public eye. Well... we sort of, we pick on targets that are...
Helpless. The elderly... you know, people suffering in some way. That really... and particularly, we don't want to pick on people like Chris Moyles who's got a big platform - much bigger platform...
Exactly. We want people who can't answer back.
Yeah, we want... yeah. So um... who do you hate?
But that's us. That's us. Who do you hate? And we don't want... I don't want people you went to school with, or your boss...
Do you know who I hate, Steve?
Right, my top three... it's only the top three...
No... probably Moylesy, Harry Potter and Jamie Oliver.
But what are your top three?

Now, don't make them comical, don't make them... These are the people that wind you up. When you see them on TV, if you hear them on the radio, if you see them in a magazine, they just... they make your kind of blood boil.
We could take it as read that it's us...
... and then if anyone other than us...
... in fact yeah, let's assume it's us and we want other people. Yeah.
Yeah. But we just... I want to draw up the top list... the top five people...
And I don't want to hear things like Tony Blair and Jeffrey Archer and fascism.
Just people who make your flesh crawl for no... for no fault of their own, really.
... because they're, you know, talentless or fat.
But that'd be good, that'd be a good long... long-term poll, wouldn't it? Over the next four weeks, and then in four weeks time when we go, we'll go "well, we're off. We're in the top ten..."
"... but here are the other nine."
So I... I think it's just genuinely gonna be quite interesting. So ricky.gervais@xfm.co.uk.
Maybe who you hate and why. It's like giving a reason in the diary room.
Yeah. That might be quite good.
You can't just nominate someone, you've gotta say "and why".
But if you can't be bothered to write "and why", just nominate.
'Cause it means... just, we've got a lot of reading to do if they start doing that, Rick.
Keep it down to one sentence.
Yeah... You know, so the reason'd be... so-and-so 'cause they can't walk. Something like that...
Now then, we were playing earlier Songs of Phrase. Um, we have had... I mean, the answers, I could literally count on the fingers of one hand.
Um... now the right answers, even less so. But um...
... do you wanna play it once more, Karl?
Read them out. Go on, what are they?
Oh, have you not got them written down?
No, I can remember them. Daddy Cool, right?
Karl mutters the Songs of Phrase to himself
Karl mutters the Songs of Phrase to himself again
"Robbin'" was Miss Robinson by Simon & Garfunkel.
Yeah. Uh, hang on a minute... never gonna stop robbin'...
"From". From Russia with Love - Matt Monro.
"Telephone". Telephone, Hanging On The Telephone - Blondie.
And then "box"... Living In A Box...
... by Living In A Box. Brilliant.
Well, listen, no one... I don't think anyone got them all right...
... if you did get them all right, I'm sorry but I gave up checking the emails a long, long time ago. So um... I'm gonna give it...
... I'm gonna give it to Michelle Flower 'cause she got a few of them right.
She got a lot right there actually, well done.
She got five out of seven so well done, Michelle, and you get all those great prizes. Incidentally, um... we mentioned that Stargate SG-1...
... I'm sure you'll look forward to that, Michelle...
... that features uh... Richard Dean Anderson. Had a lot of emails, people saying "is that the same Richard Dean Anderson, or Dicky Anders, that used to email in saying he loved the show?"
Now I've not heard from Dicky for ages. So, Dicky, if you're listening, Richard Anderson, if anyone knows Richard Anderson, what's happened to him?
I think we know his top three.
